intro: Schismatoglottis calyptrata var. concolor, commonly known as the concolor schismatoglottis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Tanzania and Kenya. The plant is characterized by its dark green, strap-like leaves and striking, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an epiphyte or in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for indoor cultivation due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
